Name: NMC111 oxide production, for Li-ion battery | NMC111 oxide | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: NMC111 oxide is produced through a multi-step calcination process. NMC111 hydroxide and lithium carbonate are mixed and heated in the calcination kiln over two rounds of mixing and calcination. Finally, the resulting material is crushed, sieved and demagnetized to obtain NMC111 oxide. The production process is completely automated and almost all electricity consumption is attributed to the calcination kiln. The facility can achieve an overall material efficiency of approximately100%. ;;Thegeneral reaction is the following:;NMC(OH)2 + Li2CO3 --> Li-NMC-O2 + CO2 + H2O.;Reference: ;;Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.
